description: House-roasted, single-origin brews are the specialty at this casual coffeehouse in a calm palette.

description: The Space Needle is an observation tower in Seattle, Washington, United States.
Chihuly Garden and Glass is an exhibit in the Seattle Center, showcasing the studio glass of Dale Chihuly.
One of the oldest continuously operated public farmers' markets in the United States.
It's a 19.1-acre park on Lake Union's north shore, in Seattle's Wallingford, at its southern end.
The Seattle Aquarium offers fun, exciting ways to discover more about the Puget Sound and our world's big ocean.
MoPOP is home to the worlds most immersive pop culture experiences in TV, music, and science fiction.
Discovery Park offers a spectacular view of the Cascade and Olympic Mountain ranges with a scenic lighthouse.
Experience historical and contemporary art pieces and galleries at the incredible SAM exhibitions.
A beautiful spot for a long walk across Elliott Bay, with many restaurants and shops nearby.
Explore exciting wildlife and the 1000 animals who call Woodland Park Zoo home.
Treat yourself to delicious and unique Italian meals with a great ambience at this popular spot.
The Cheshiahud Lake Union Loop offers a scenic waterfront walk around Lake Union, providing stunning views of the lake and city skyline, ideal for a leisurely stroll.
The Lake Washington Loop offers a scenic pathway along the lake's shores, perfect for a leisurely walk or bike ride with beautiful views.
The Burke-Gilman Trail is a popular 18-mile biking route in Seattle, offering scenic views and a relaxing ride from Ballard to Bothell.
The Sammamish River Trail is a popular biking route in Seattle, offering scenic views along the river from Bothell to Redmond.
Myrtle Edwards Park in Seattle offers a scenic waterfront bike trail with stunning views of Elliott Bay and the Olympic Mountains.
A 268-foot waterfall, located east of Seattle on the Snoqualmie River.
Mount Rainier National Park offers breathtaking hiking trails with stunning views of the majestic Mount Rainier.
The Cedar River Trail is a beautiful hike along the Cedar River, offering picturesque views of the river, surrounding forests, and opportunities for birdwatching and wildlife spotting.
Evans Creek Preserve is a natural oasis with hiking trails through forests, meadows, and wetlands, offering a peaceful escape and wildlife observation opportunities.
Soaring Eagle Regional Park offers a network of scenic hiking trails through lush forests and open meadows, providing a peaceful retreat and opportunities for wildlife viewing.
The Wildside Trail - De Leo Wall is a challenging hike with stunning mountain and valley views, ideal for seasoned hikers seeking a thrilling outdoor adventure.
Poo Poo Point in the Issaquah Alps is a popular hiking spot with panoramic mountain and valley views, attracting paragliders and hikers alike.

Elliott Bay in Seattle offers stunning views of the city skyline, the Olympic Mountains, and Mount Rainier. It's popular for kayaking, sailing, and waterfront dining, providing a quintessential Seattle experience.
The West Seattle waterfront offers stunning views of the Puget Sound and downtown Seattle, providing a picturesque setting for a leisurely stroll or bike ride along the water's edge.
David E. Brink Park in Kirkland offers stunning waterfront views of Lake Washington and the Seattle skyline, perfect for a relaxing stroll by the water.
Meydenbauer Park in Bellevue offers scenic views of Lake Washington, providing a peaceful escape for a leisurely stroll or a day of picnicking by the water.
The Foster Island Trail offers a peaceful nature walk through wetlands and forests in Seattle's Washington Park Arboretum, providing a serene escape from the city.
City Cycle offers high-energy cycling workouts driven by music, with passionate trainers, top-notch equipment for an authentic ride, promising exceptional results, and a pure love for what they do.
Commune Yoga provides a welcoming and inclusive space for yoga practitioners, emphasizing punctuality, hydration, and personal mat preferences to enhance comfort and enjoyment.
Emerald City Athletics is a premier fitness facility offering top-notch equipment, expert trainers, and a supportive community to help you achieve your fitness goals.
Pop Rox Dance Studio offers dynamic classes for dancers of all levels, providing a vibrant space to refine skills and ignite creativity.
Downtown shopping hub offering a range of shops, eateries, and access to the Monorail.
Upscale shopping center in Bellevue with a mix of luxury and popular retailers, plus dining options and a cinema.
Large shopping mall in Tukwila with a wide range of stores, restaurants, and entertainment options.
Outdoor shopping center near the University of Washington campus with a variety of shops and dining options in a park-like setting.
A modern facility offering diverse academic resources and study spaces for Seattle University students and faculty.
A contemporary library offering a wide range of materials and programs for all ages in the Bellevue community.
A Gothic-style building at the University of Washington with a vast collection of books, periodicals, and digital resources.
A modern architectural masterpiece housing a vast collection of books, media, and digital resources.
Known for its fresh oysters and innovative seafood dishes, this restaurant offers a cozy, intimate atmosphere in the heart of Ballard.
Elliott's is famous for its seafood buffet and stunning views of Puget Sound, offering a true taste of the Pacific Northwest.
A local favorite, Taylor Shellfish Farms serves up a variety of sustainably harvested shellfish, including oysters, clams, and mussels, with a focus on quality and freshness.
Ivar's is renowned for its classic fish and chips and clam chowder, served in a casual, family-friendly setting on the waterfront.
The Crab Pot is a lively waterfront spot where diners can enjoy a variety of seafood cooked in a large pot and dumped onto the table for a fun, interactive dining experience.
This Hawaiian-Korean fusion truck is famous for its flavorful dishes like the SPAM musubi and Kalbi beef tacos.
Nosh serves up British-inspired street food with a Pacific Northwest twist, featuring dishes like fish and chips and savory pies made with locally sourced ingredients.
Where Ya At Matt serves up classic Creole dishes like gumbo, po'boys, and beignets, all made with authentic Louisiana flavors.
Specializing in Native American cuisine, Off the Rez serves up delicious fry bread tacos and other indigenous-inspired dishes with a modern twist.
A popular hangout for students and locals alike, Cafe Solstice offers a cozy atmosphere, strong coffee, and tasty pastries.
A stylish cafe serving artisanal coffee and locally sourced dishes in a modern setting.
A cozy cafe with a mission to make the world better through coffee, offering a warm atmosphere and ethically sourced beans.
Seattle's oldest espresso bar, Cafe Allegro offers a charming, vintage ambiance and a wide selection of coffee drinks.
A hip cafe known for its carefully crafted espresso drinks, spacious interior, and laid-back vibe.
Offering panoramic views of the city skyline, Elliott Bay, and Mount Rainier, Kerry Park is a popular spot for both sunrise and sunset, providing a stunning backdrop for your photos.
Golden Gardens Park offers sandy beaches and stunning views of the Olympic Mountains, making it a popular spot for watching the sunset.
Nestled along the Puget Sound, Carkeek Park Beach offers rocky shores, scenic walking trails, and views of the Olympic Mountains and Puget Sound.
Madison Park Beach features a sandy swimming area, grassy picnic spots, and beautiful views of the lake and surrounding mountains.
The Crocodile has hosted iconic bands and continues to showcase both local and national talent in an intimate setting.
Neumos offers a vibrant atmosphere and excellent sound quality, making it a favorite among music lovers.
A cozy venue in the Ballard neighborhood, The Sunset features an intimate stage and a diverse lineup of local and touring artists..
Offering a unique experience that combines live music with gourmet dining, The Triple Door is a classy venue known for its acoustics and elegant ambiance.
GameWorks offers a diverse range of arcade games, virtual reality experiences, and classic favorites in a vibrant entertainment setting.
This museum features a collection of playable pinball machines from different eras, offering a nostalgic gaming experience.
Add-a-Ball Arcade features a retro vibe with a variety of classic arcade games and pinball machines.
Round1 in Southcenter Mall offers a wide range of arcade games, bowling, karaoke, and other entertainment options for all ages.
A leading regional theater known for its diverse productions and commitment to artistic excellence.
Renowned for its exceptional musical performances and innovative programming, the Seattle Symphony is a cultural gem of the city.
Internationally acclaimed for its artistic innovation and superb performances, Pacific Northwest Ballet is a cornerstone of the Seattle dance scene.
A contemporary theater presenting bold and thought-provoking performances by local and national artists.
Offers hands-on glassblowing classes and workshops for all skill levels, allowing participants to create their own glass art.
A nonprofit organization offering eco-friendly art classes and workshops using recycled materials, promoting sustainability and creativity.
A vibrant space where children can learn through play and exploration, featuring interactive exhibits and educational programs..
A unique play space offering imaginative play experiences and creative activities for children of all ages.
Explore Seattle's subterranean passages and learn about the city's history, including its early pioneers and the Great Seattle Fire of 1889.
Discover Seattle's oldest neighborhood, Pioneer Square, with its historic buildings, including the famous Smith Tower, and learn about the city's early days.
A unique play space offering imaginative play experiences and creative activities for children of all ages.
Seattle's premier music and arts festival, featuring a diverse lineup of music, comedy, film, and more.
A three-day music and arts festival showcasing indie rock, hip-hop, and electronic music in the heart of Capitol Hill.
A festival celebrating emerging artists and innovative music experiences, curated by local music legend, Macklemore.
A vibrant festival showcasing a diverse array of street food vendors from the Pacific Northwest and beyond.
One of the city's largest food festivals, Bite of Seattle features over 60 restaurants and pop-up vendors offering a taste of the region's culinary delights.
Highlighting Seattle's rich seafood heritage, SeafoodFest offers a variety of seafood dishes, cooking demonstrations, and live music.
A vibrant market near the University of Washington campus, showcasing farm-fresh produce, baked goods, and specialty foods.
Located in the West Seattle Junction, this market offers a variety of locally grown produce, flowers, and artisanal products.
Serving the diverse Columbia City neighborhood, this market offers a range of local produce, crafts, and prepared foods every Wednesday.
Seattle's longest-running market featuring local crafts, antiques, and food in the eclectic Fremont neighborhood.
A treasure trove of vintage finds and collectibles, offering a diverse selection of antiques and unique items.
Featuring a mix of new, used, and handmade items, SODO Flea Market is a popular destination for bargain hunters.
Experience indoor rock climbing at one of the country's largest bouldering gyms, suitable for all skill levels.
Take a ride on this iconic Ferris wheel on the waterfront, offering breathtaking views of the city skyline and Puget Sound.
Experience the sensation of skydiving in a safe and controlled environment, with a vertical wind tunnel that simulates freefall conditions.
Long-standing outfit serving beer, stout & numerous whiskeys, plus pub grub & regular live music.
Brewpub in yellow brick building open since 1988, drawing college crowd with suds, pizza & bar fare.
